question: A Python script is a file that contains Python code and is saved with the .py extension.
The Python Interactive Shell (IDLE) does not allow users to execute Python commands immediately.
Python scripts can only be run using an installed Python interpreter and not through an online compiler.
The command `python welcome.py` is used to run a Python script from the command line.
Python requires a semicolon at the end of every print statement.
The function `print()` is used to display messages on the screen in Python.
In Python, the `input()` function is used to receive user input.
Python scripts must always contain a `main()` function to execute properly.
A Python script saved with the .txt extension can be executed directly by the Python interpreter.
A Python script can be created using Notepad, VS Code, or PyCharm.
In Python, `print("Hello, World!")` will display an error because it lacks a semicolon.
The command `cd Desktop` is used to change the directory to the Desktop before running a script.
Python scripts cannot be executed from the terminal or command prompt.
A Python script must always be named `script.py` to run successfully.
In Python, using `*` in a print statement can be used to repeat characters.
Python allows users to format output messages using variables and string concatenation.
To run a Python script online, we can use platforms like Programiz and Replit.
A Python script can contain multiple print statements to display multiple messages.
To execute a Python script in IDLE, we must press F5 or click 'Run Module'.
Python does not support user input through the `input()` function.
Python scripts require compilation before execution.
The command `python --version` is used to check the installed Python version.
Python programs can only be executed in PyCharm.
The print statement `print("Welcome to Python!")` will output: Welcome to Python!
Python scripts can include loops, such as a `for` loop, to repeat messages multiple times.
Python scripts can only be run on Windows operating systems.
Python programs can only be written in an IDE and not in a text editor.
In Python, a variable can be assigned a string value and used in a print statement.
Python uses indentation instead of brackets `{}` for code blocks.
Running `print(Welcome to Python!)` without quotes will result in an error.
Python scripts do not require a specific file extension.
Online Python compilers allow users to execute Python scripts without installing Python on their system.
The `print()` function can display numbers, text, and variables.
Python programs can run without being saved to a file using the interactive shell.
Python scripts cannot contain more than one print statement.
In Python, the `#` symbol is used to write comments in scripts.
The `input()` function in Python requires an argument inside the parentheses.
A Python script can be executed multiple times without modification.
A Python script must contain at least one variable declaration.
Python is a case-sensitive language, so `Print()` is different from `print()`.
The `print()` function can only display text and not numbers.
Python requires double quotes for strings and does not support single quotes.
Python scripts can be modified and re-executed without re-installing Python.
Python allows multiple variables to be declared in a single line.
A Python script cannot be executed inside a Jupyter Notebook.
To run a Python script in PyCharm, you must create a new Python project.
Python programs always require an internet connection to run.
A Python script can contain functions and loops.
The command `python3 script.py` can be used on Linux and macOS to run a Python script.
Python scripts must always start with a comment describing the program.
